pull.title: rpc: Remove mempool global from miner
pull.body: The miner needs read-only access to the mempool. Instead of using the mutable global `::mempool`, keep a immutable reference to a mempool that is passed to the miner. Apart from the obvious benefits of removing a global and making things immutable, this might also simplify testing with multiple mempools.

events.body:
Strong concept ACK

Also welcome from a fuzz testing perspective :)

### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#17693](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/17693.html) (rpc: Add generateblock to mine a custom set of transactions by andrewtoth)
* [#17375](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/17375.html) (Add asymptotes for benchmarking framework by JeremyRubin)
* [#17268](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/17268.html) (Epoch Mempool by JeremyRubin)
* [#16975](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/16975.html) (test: Show debug log on unit test failure by MarcoFalke)
* [#16411](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/16411.html) (BIP-325: Signet support by kallewoof)
* [#16333](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/16333.html) (test: Set BIP34Height = 2 for regtest by MarcoFalke)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
Concept ACK, but this will make me sad from a rebasing perspective ;)

events.body:
ACK faa92a2297b4a6aebdd58d1818c428f1c0346078

Reviewed code, tested locally.

Code review ACK faa92a2297b4a6aebdd58d1818c428f1c0346078

A couple of nits inline. Feel free to ignore.

comments.body:
Maybe I oversaw it but is it really necessary to include this variable into the header?
As far as I know it should work just fine if just the pointer is included in the header file.
This is not declaring a variable, it's forward declaring the type RegTestingSetup.
Yes, it's defined in src/test/util/setup_common.h which isn't included at this point.
nit: order member initialization list the same as the parameter list (and preferably on one line)

nit: place this either at the start of the function (so it exits early if there is no mempool), or immediately before the call to `generateBlocks()`. Placing it between the code that creates `coinbase_script` and the coinbase_script CHECK seems random.

Same comment for `generatetoaddress()`
Might do in a follow-up to not invalidate the three reviews
